intro: Psychotria costivenia, commonly known as the Amazonian psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of dense rainforest canopies. Psychotria costivenia is also noted for its role in traditional medicine and its potential pharmacological properties.
